problem: When Frederick was born, his grandparents gave him a gift of $\$2000$, which was invested at a simple interest rate of $5\%$ per year.  How much money will Frederick have when he can collect the money at the age of $18$?  (Assume no money is added to the account besides the interest.)
solution: If the interest is simple, then Frederick's money grows by $\allowbreak .05(2000)=100$ dollars per year.  This means he gained $18\times100=\$1800$, so he has a total of $2000+1800=\boxed{\$3800}$.
chatgpt_solution: At the end of each year, the balance of the account is multiplied by $1 + \frac{0.05}{1} = 1.05$.  After the money is compounded $18$ times, the amount of money Frederick has is $2000 \cdot 1.05^{18} \approx \boxed{\$5632.69}$.
